Character Tables of Groups of Structure M.G.A
For the functions in this section, let H be a group with normal subgroups N and M such that H/N is cyclic, M \leq N holds, and such that each irreducible character of N that does not contain M in its kernel induces irreducibly to H. (This is satisfied for example if N has prime index in H and M is a group of prime order that is central in N but not in H.) Let G = N/M and A = H/N, so H has the structure M.G.A.
